text: We'll need to create a key pair for authentication so that we can connect
to the Amazon EC2 instance running our Oracle database.
Public AMI instances use a public/private key pair to log in
The public key half of this pair is embedded in your instance,
allowing you to use the private key to log in securely without a password.
In the AWS Management console, click on Services and select EC2.
In the Navigation pane, under Network and Security, click Key Pairs.
In the Create Key Pair dialog box, give your key pair a name.
In this example, we will use mykeypair.
The private key file will be downloaded to your computer.
Keep it in a safe place, as you will need it to access any instances that you launch with this key pair.
For more information about key pairs, see Getting an SSH Key Pair
in the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud User Guide.
